text:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1672820411528749>
Any idea on how to call on brand_settings values via JS ?

You can try this, in your base.html add this in the head
`<meta name="hs-brand-color" content="{{ brand_settings.colors[0].hex }}">`

Then in your JS
`const hsBrandColor = document.head.querySelector("meta[name='hs-brand-color']")`

Not exactly what I need. You see I want to iterate dynamically trough the 19 colours I can have. So instead of writing 19 entries to an array with all the avail colours, I'd like to iterate from 1 to 19, and convert them to HSL.  Like this, but not with a predefined array hard coded.
Its a dynamically way of generating accent colours from the brand_settings .. In that way I can create theme variations and dynamically create the opposite colours based on the brand colour ..
So my question is really if I can call or get an object in JS that has these colours populated ..
Hey! Does anyone know if itâ€™s possible to use a custom repeater module in a custom quote template?
